intro: Fissistigma uonicum, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Fissistigma uonicum is often found in woodland edges and moist meadows, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
